description.text:
Citigroup Global Markets Inc. seeks a Quantitative Analyst for its New York, New York location. 
Duties: Develop, test and maintain mathematical models for market forecasting of mortgages, interest rate modeling, calculation of prepayments, defaults and losses, and analysis of Basel capital requirements, for residential and commercial mortgages and other asset-backed securities. Use statistical, mathematical, and machine learning approaches to model mortgage borrower prepayment and default behavior. Perform advanced computerized quantitative analysis, involving the use of highly sophisticated quantitative methodologies including linear and non-linear optimization, Monte Carlo simulations, statistics, and numerical methods, to aid in the development and maintenance of the Residential Mortgage Backed Security (“RMBS”) default, prepayment, loss severity, and roll rate transition models. Analyze large datasets to identify market trends. Employ programming languages and technologies, including C, C++, R, SQL, Python, Perl, and VBA, to ensure the accurate implementation of the models on various analytical platforms. Communicate with internal and external model users to explain the workings of the models.
EEO Statement
Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Minority/Female/Veteran/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
Primary Location
NAM-USA-NY-New York
Job Category
Trading
Schedule
Full-time
Education Level
Master's Degree
Shift
Day Job
Employee Status
Regular
Travel
No
Office Location / Address
388-390 Greenwich St, New York, New York, 10013
Requirements: Requires a Master’s degree in Computational Finance, Mathematics or related quantitative field and 3 years of experience as a Quantitative Analyst/Associate, Model Development Analyst, or related position performing quantitative modeling in the financial services industry. Must have 3 years of work experience with: Mathematical and statistical analysis of datasets; Quantitative modeling for securitized products, including mortgage and asset backed securities; Developing and implementing models using C++ programming, VBA, R, SQL, Python and Perl; Modelling Basel or CCAR regulatory capital requirements; Using machine learning to develop models. Qualified applicants submit resumes referencing job code EJ/QA/RH to Citigroup Recruiting Department, 3800 Citigroup Center Drive, Tampa, FL 33610. Citigroup is an EOE Employer. This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Citigroup’s Employee Referral Program. Direct applicants only.
